result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court calls 22CF45, 20CM111 & 21CM156 @ 11:26 AM Defendant Timothy C. Miller appeared by video, in custody from Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. is eligible for Public Defender and def. would like to continue to wait.  Court gives defendant options. Def. questions court appointed attorney. Court finds def. is eligible for Public Defender. Court will expand options for court appointed atty. Court orders $250 down and $150 a month. Def. does not want to pay and will continue to wait for Public Defender.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - 2nd or Subsequent Attorney
Pro-Se Motion for Bond Modification -Routed to JA

1:40 PM Defendant Timothy C. Miller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly L Hays appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed file. Defendant requests modification of current cash bond to a $10,000 cash bond. State objects to request of bond modification. State believes previous bond is appropriate. State advises court of offenses. Remarks by court. Court denies the request of bond modification. State has complied with victims rights.

01:52 PM Defendant Timothy C. Miller in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Timothy C. Miller in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy C. OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bond De Novo
Routed to JA
Bail/Bond

No contact with minors unless nieces or nephews of defendant with supervised visitation, surrender passport to sheriff's department if one is possessed by defendant, and no leaving the state of Wisconsin.

10:57 AM Defendant Timothy C. Miller in court with attorney John Zich.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy C. Miller appeared by video means with Attorney John Zich.  All parties via Zoom.  Case is called and reviewed by the Court. Attorney Zich makes statement regarding motion. Attorney Hayes makes statement regarding victims. Court confirms there are no victims present in court gallery. Attorney Zich requests reduced bail and gives argument. $50,000 current cash bond with conditions. ADA objects to modification and makes statement regarding their motion to change conditions. ADA gives response to request. Court gives ruling. Court grants bail bond request modification. Court proposes a $30,000 cash bond. ADA makes statement of a modification of conditions of bond of no contact with any minors and supervised visitation with minors unless nieces or nephews of defendant, surrender passport with sheriff's department if one is possessed, and no leaving the state of Wisconsin. Attorney Zich makes argument and responds for modification of conditions. Court orders a $30,000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with minors unless nieces or nephews of defendant with supervised visitation, surrender passport to sheriff's department if one is possessed by defendant, and no leaving the state of Wisconsin. Court is adjourned.
to Modify Bond Conditions
Bail/bond hearing on April 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

01:21 PM Defendant Timothy C. Miller in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Timothy C. Miller in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zich is still requesting preliminary hearing. Daniel Duley, Captain for City of Antigo Police Department, duly sworn under oath, testifies. State rest. Defense is contesting bind over. State request bind over and gives statement.  Atty Zich move for dismissal. Court question statute.  State heard on law for hear say and State has burden.  Court finds probable cause and binds over for filing an information.  State heard on bond modification.  Atty Zich make statement. Court will have JA set bail/bond hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:24 PM Defendant Timothy C. Miller in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy C. Miller appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Victim appears via telephone.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Def. is going to contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. heard on bond. Court orders $50,000 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
